description:
Hi Jennifer,
 
Hope you are well. We are looking for experts with solid knowledge about Food & Beverage market in Vietnam, details as following:
 
·         Industry: Packaged Food & beverage, especially in biscuits, cakes, confectionary and snacks

·         Questions:

o    Can you comment on the trends of biscuits, cakes, confectionary and snack industry in Vietnam in the recent quarters?

o    What are the key drivers for these trends?

·         Work experience:

o    Experts who work for market research agencies cover Vietnam

o    Experts who work for F&B retailers and distributors

o    Experts who are former employees of leading F&B companies in Vietnam, such as:

§  Orion

§  Bibica

§  Hai Ha Co

§  Mars

§  Lotte

·         Case code: AKMG

·         Timeline: We are hoping to have 1-2 first calls tomorrow. We would appreciate if you can send us a list of potential experts by end of today.

 
Let me know if you have any question! Thank you!
 
Best,
 
Vanessa Tran

We’re also interested in looking at more distributor/retailer/wholesaler profiles in the bakery/confectionery sector. Please update me if you have fresh profiles from that category. Thank you!

Just wanted to update you on a new angle we’re targeting. We’re looking to speak to an industry expert for packaged bakery (bread, buns, rolls) who will be able to speak on the market growth of the category in Vietnam.
 
Could you help us pull some profiles? We’re looking at a tight timeline, so we would like to speak to an expert before the end of the week.
specialNotes:
Our firm connects global investors/management consulting firms with industry experts for research consultation. Currently, we are looking for experts on Vietnam packaged bakery. Can we have a call to discuss?

Regards,
Martin

[The Straits Network] Consulting Opportunity - Vietnam Confectionery Industry

Thank you for connecting with me.

Our firm, The Straits Network, is an Asia-focused Expert Network based in Singapore & Hong Kong. We connect global investors and consulting firms with industry experts for research consultations. Currently, we are looking for experts on Vietnam packaged bakery to comment on the market growth. Given your experience with xxx, we thought that you would be an ideal expert candidate. This consulting opportunity will not interfere with your current job or position, nor is it a full-time offer.

Can I give you a call for 5 – 10 minutes to further discuss? Please let us know a number where you can be reached and a good time for the call.

Thanks and we look forward to speaking with you soon.
Best Regards,
Martin

description:
Hi Maria
 
I am currently looking for 1 expert in Malaysia on the hearing aid (HA) market for an interview Monday/Tuesday next week
·         Manufacturer dynamics (who are leading players, market share and trends)

·         Channel dynamics (hospital v. HA store (manufacturer owned or other) v. retail pharmacy v. others)—what channels are dominant, who are the key players, any market share info

description:
Hi,

My name is Changmin Shin, from Bain & Company Seoul office, and I received your contact from our information service (research) team.
I am writing to request expert search and interview arrange.
The expert profile we are looking for and screening questions are as below.

· Company: Tesco Bank(UK), Aeon Bank(Japan), Rakuten Bank(Japan)

· Topic: Internet/online-based banking, Fin-tech

· Screening questions

o What is the major target customer of your company?

o How does your company successfully entice customers from existing offline-based banks?

o What kind of service does your company provide? (e.g., payment, transfer, deposit, loan, or commission)

o What is the difference between existing/offline-based biz. models and new/online-based models?

o How much investment was needed to launch/operate the online bank, and what about the outcome?

If you have any questions, please let me know.
I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best,
Changmin Shin

========

Hi Jennifer,

I’m sorry for late reply.
Here is information on our project.
1. What is the case code for this project? AAFV
2. What is the nature of your end client (ie. PE firm, online banking player, offline bank, etc.)? This will help us assess conflicts of interest. one of the Korean commercial banks
3. What is your timing/deadline for expert interviews? ASAP. The deadline of our case is the end of June (4 weeks). FYI.
4.

In addition to this, could you look for another experts as below?
Target company: Dunnhumby
· Screening questions

o Do you have any experience working for Tesco Bank(Internet-based banking)?

o How does Dunnhumy suggest customized products for each customer based on big data?

o What kind of customer data does Dunnhumby analyze for Tesco Bank?

o What is the outcome? Is it successful or not? (e.g., number of customers, deposits)

· Language: English

Target company: (1) Jibun Bank, (2) Seven Bank, (3) SBI Sumishin Net Bank, and (4) Ally Bank
· Department: Strategy and marketing are preferred, but other departments would be okay.

· Language: English

Thank you for your help in advance.

Best,
Changmin

projectSpecificExperts.experience:
I started my own company – the Hong China Tea Company in early 2012. I soon realized that I needed professional assistance and sparring to get success. I therefore decided to make it a joint venture with a Danish partner where I have the full ownership of the company, my partner is assisting in strategy development and execution combined with international sales activity.

In august 2012 we received an unexpected honour when two of our spring 2012 Oolong teas won a triple gold medal in the prestigious British competition “The Great Taste Awards” – among industry experts called the British food and beverage Oscar®. It confirmed us about the work we do in the company.

We work hard to produce - and export - some of the world’s finest high quality superior Chinese tea products available with focus on no less than outstanding quality and customer service. For us an order from a customer is sign of trust and confidence in the work we do. We believe in fair trade with our suppliers because if they can live from what they produce, they will get us the very best products they have which will be to the benefit of not only the company – but most important also to the benefit of our customers.

We never go on a compromise when it comes to the customer service we provide our customers and we even invite them to come and see our way of doing things on tailor made tea tours if wanted. We want them to have a taste of the finest the ancient Chinese tea culture has to offer.

For us tea is not a product – it is history and a part of the Chinese cultural inheritance.

Please feel free to connect if you share the same passion for tea or would like to know more about our company. The motto of the Hong China Tea Company is “With passion to Perfection” – and we try our best in the daily work to remember this very important teaching. We would be proud to become your supplier and we are sure that we can meet your expectations.

ITCC help tea lovers, entrepreneurs world wide to cup together.
Check www.teacuppers.com for lastest news.

description:
Dear Jennifer,
 
Hope you’re well. We’re doing market research into the premium tea market (quality tea that is either consumed in loose leaf or tea bag form, sometimes used for gifting purposes). We’re interested in both retail sales of it and distribution to airlines/hotels/premium restaurants. As such, we’d like to speak to two kinds of experts:
 
Tea market experts  
 
The expert should be able to speak about at least one of the following markets (preferably more):
 
1.    China

2.    Hong Kong

3.    Taiwan

4.    Malaysia

5.    Singapore     

 
Some screening questions for the experts each of the markets:
 
1.       What is the size of the retail market for premium tea? What has historical growth been and what are the growth drivers?

a.    Broken down into loose leaf tea and premium tea bags

b.    What are the key sales channels for each market? (online, retail, on-premise consumption etc.)

c.    What differences are there between buying tea for personal or family consumption vs. buying tea for gifting? What are their key purchasing criteria?

2.       What is the current positioning of key players? What is their business model like (retail vs. wholesale focus)

3.       Particularly on China: Given the anti-corruption drive of the Chinese government, what is the outlook for sales of premium tea?

  

F&B Purchasing Managers of hotel chains, airlines, and premium restaurants
 
The expert should be able to speak about at least one of the following markets (preferably more):
 
1.    China

2.    Hong Kong

3.    Taiwan

4.    Malaysia

5.    Singapore     

 
Some screening questions for the experts each of the markets:
 
1.       What is the size of the wholesale market for premium tea (Broken down into loose leaf tea and premium tea bags) to the following channels:

a.    Hotels (Hilton, Starwood etc.)

b.    Airlines

c.    Premium restaurants

2.       What has historical growth been and what are the growth drivers?

a.    What are these wholesale purchasers’ key purchasing criteria?

3.       What is the current positioning of key players?

 
 
Can we get a first cut of profiles by this afternoon?
 
Thank you! We don’t have a case code yet but will provide one to you as soon as we get it.

description:
Dear Jennifer,
 
Hope you’re doing well! We are hoping to contact some experts over the next few days as part of a client development effort (case code: XHT) for a due diligence.
 
We are looking for experts in connector industry globally, particularly:
·           Former employees of the largest connector companies (TE Connectivity, Amphenol, Molex, FoxConn, Delphi)

o    C-suite executives

o    Heads of strategy

o    Heads of manufacturing

 
The interview will center around several key topics such as:
·         What is the market’s growth trajectory?

·         What are the business models of major players?

·         What are the key tech trends in the industry? Product mix?

·         How has the competitive landscape been evolving?

·         What are some risks in this industry and value creation opportunities?

 
Please note that we will need to run a list of companies in which candidates are presently employed against our internal conflict ID system. We would appreciate it if you could send a list of their companies, positions and designations to us before reaching out to these interviewees.

description:
Hi Jennifer. 

Please find the details of the other project we need your assistance on. 
Please note this is a live project and we have started work on it. 


So we need 2 set of interviews : Enterprise end users and Vendors. 
Details are there in the Excel wrt Companies, target titles/designations and the nature of discussions. 

The end client is a solution provider interested in opportunities identification in the Mining Oil and Gas sector. 

Abhishek will be leading this project and let me/Abhsihek know incase you have any queries . 
But again would appreciate a response by end of week on the nature of experts you can get interviews based on these criteria. 

===============================================

Hi Jennifer, 

We are interested in two categories: 

1. End Users in 4 countries. 
2. Vendors in US & Canada. 

We have already been able to talk to vendors in Australia and Indonesia. Also we are looking to start it as soon as possible and we will need to finish it by 12th of June. 

In terms of quantitative estimation, we are not really looking for anything sensitive. What we are hoping to get is: (i) Total Market size estimates (not market share or revenue) and (ii) Spending on these IT solutions (by end users). While (ii) may be a bit sensitive, even broad estimates will help us. 

Hope this answers your questions. 

Regards, 
Abhishek 

===================================================

Martin

Martin

Other

description:
Hi Jennifer,
 
Hope you are well.
 
We would like to request a list of experts, focusing on Offshore O&G Structure Fabrication, Hook-up and Commissioning in Asia. Would be great if you can provide the list ASAP as we would like to schedule couple of calls today/tomorrow..
 
Ideal profile would be: Head of Engineering, Projects, Fabrication and Hook-up & Commissioning  / yard operation manager for Offshore O&G Structure:
·         Singapore yards

o   Keppel, Sembcorp, DynaMac

·         Indonesia yards

o   Saipem, McDermott

·         Chinese yards

 
The expert must be able to answer the following questions:
·         What drives profits? What are the key operational metrics used in benchmarking yard efficiency?

·         How effective are key EPCIC players using their existing yard space and where are they building/expanding their yard spaces?

·         What key capabilities and differentiating assets do your company possess? Which one of those capabilities/assets is a reason for differentiation?

·         How will the SE Asia market for EPCIC services evolve in the near future? What are the key fundamentals and growth drivers across different SE Asia countries?

 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Many thanks,
KD

Thanks for following up. Unfortunately, the expert wasn’t able to answer most of the questions we posed, hence we ended the call earlier.
 
Could you please also provide a list of Fabrication, Hook-up & Commissioning experts who used to work for the following companies:
·         SapuraKencana

·         McDermott SEA

·         MMHE

 
Many thanks,
KD
specialNotes:
Our firm connects global investors/management consulting firms with industry experts for research consultation. Currently, we are looking for experts in offshore oil & gas structure fabrication sector. Can we have a call to discuss?

Regards,
Martin

[The Straits Network] Consulting Opportunity - offshore oil & gas structure fabrication

Thank you for connecting with me.

Our firm, The Straits Network, is an Asia-focused Expert Network based in Singapore & Hong Kong. We connect global investors and consulting firms with industry experts for research consultations. Currently, we are looking for experts in offshore oil & gas structure fabrication, hook-up and commissioning sector to comment on yard efficiency. Given your experience with xxx, we thought that you would be an ideal expert candidate. This consulting opportunity will not interfere with your current job or position, nor is it a full-time offer.

Can I give you a call for 5 – 10 minutes to further discuss? Please let us know a number where you can be reached and a good time for the call.

Thanks and we look forward to speaking with you soon.
Best Regards,
Martin

description:
Evan,
 
we’re looking to engage experienced senior management personnel - ideally someone who has had experience running a Japanese Sushi restaurant/chain for ~10 years or more) – to consult alongside our team on site visits to similar restaurant outlets in Indonesia and Malaysia (for 1.5 weeks) and Singapore (0.5 weeks) later this month.
 
We would like the expert to join us on outlet store checks to interview store level management, analyse operational KPIs (e.g. capacity utilization, staffing, food wastage, menu offerings etc.) as part of an exercise to provide a view on the cost reduction potential/strategy our target company can possibly pursue.
 
To give a few examples, former CEO-level or senior managers of chains such as Genki Sushi, Ichiban Boshi, Sakae Sushi, Sushi Tei, Itacho Sushi, etc. would be highly relevant.
 
Let us know if you can help us source such experts.
 
Regards,
 Warren Hua | 65 8125 2100

description:
Hi 

We are working on a high priority client development opportunity in India (with a real estate developer). In this context, need your help in identifying an expert on design of mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems for high-rise buildings. 

Such experts could be working in firms such as Jacobs Engineering, Parsons Brinckerhoff, Exp, HDR Inc. Stantec Inc. etc. and should be either leading design functions or should be a senior designer. We are agnostic to the geography the expert has experience in (though would prefer an expert that can speak English well).

CC: IN1310 (a client development effort). 

This is a time critical request and would be great if you can revert with a few profiles before EOD.

Thanks a ton in advance!!

Regards,
Anish

=========

1) This is for a residential high-rise
2) ED is Suveer Sinha and EM would be me
3) This is a proposal for an engagement, hence even preliminary profiles should work for now  -

For this month, we plan to have 1-2 discussions to A) screen the expert, and B) start preliminary discussions on design optimization
From July (when the engagement should kick-off), we would need to interact with experts over a 3 month period with a min. of 8-10 discussions

4) Context of expert conversations: Would need expert inputs to review the designs (prepared by Indian firms) and come out with ideas for cost savings through design optimization of MEP systems

=========

Thanks Jin. This is helpful but we are currently not very keen to onboard an Indian expert.

In the meanwhile, I have spoken to a few people who know the design space well, and they suggested that we try and identify MEP design experts from the following companies - WS Atkins, Arup, WSP Global, Ian Banham & Associates, Meinhardt, Cosentini Associates, and Buro Happold.

They also suggested that we look for subject specific experts, i.e., experts in HVAC / Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing / Fire fighting. This is because very few people have deep technical expertise across the board in this area. Therefore, could you please push our search to experts from these firms.

Regards,
Anish

Experts from South East Asia and Middle East would be best suited (given that they are English speaking and in the same approx. time zone).

description:
Hi Jin, Jennifer 

How are you doing? 
We had recently worked together on a project on Animal feed ingredient industry, and your support in that was quite useful. Currently, we are working on another project spanning across select products in petrochemical and petroleum industries. Hence, we would like to conduct some discussions with experts in these fields. Will appreciate if you can respond promptly on this. 

I am detailing out the requirements and scope below for your quick understanding 

1. Products to be covered ~ 10 in number 
Polystyrene, Expandable polystyrene, polypropylene, High density polyethylene (HDPE), Ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMWPE), Acetylene black, Acrylonitrile butadiene styrene (ABS), Lubes (focus on base oil - group I, II, III and others), Asphalt, and Nanomaterials (focus on Zinc oxide, titanium dioxide) 

2. Number of expert discussions ~ 1-2 per product 
Focus is to have discussions with experts who can comment and suggest on trends related to R&D, product development, technical marketing, and existing and upcoming growth avenues within these. 

3. We are looking to conduct these discussions in the next 1-2 weeks. 

4. Geographic focus 
The regions of focus are: Global and Southeast Asia 

5. Company focus 
Sample companies: For ABS, manufacturers such as Chi Mei, BASF, SABIC, Bayer, LG Chem and other similar companies 
For Lubes, manufacturers such as Shell, Exxon Mobil, Total, Petronas and other similar companies 

Similarly, we want to focus on large (within TOP 5) manufacturers for each of the products. 

6. Sample questions 

Some sample questions can be as follows 

- Existing R&D focus 

- R&D, innovation process flow 

- Strategic R&D, product development plans 

- Avenues or opportunities for growth for players in the market for specific product (from the ones listed) 

- How customer needs are changing. Understanding what customers are increasingly seeking or would seek in future 

Best,
specialNotes:
Our firm connects global investors/management consulting firms with industry experts for research consultation. Currently, we are looking for experts in petrochemical industry to comment on R&D development. Can we have a call to discuss?

Regards,
Martin

[The Straits Network] Consulting Opportunity - Petrochemical Industry

Thank you for connecting with me.

Our firm, The Straits Network, is an Asia-focused Expert Network based in Singapore & Hong Kong. We connect global investors and consulting firms with industry experts for research consultations. Currently, we are looking for experts in petrochemical industry to comment on R&D development and Innovation Process. Given your experience with xxx, we thought that you would be an ideal expert candidate. This consulting opportunity will not interfere with your current job or position, nor is it a full-time offer.

Can I give you a call for 5 – 10 minutes to further discuss? Please let us know a number where you can be reached and a good time for the call.

description:
We are conducting a project for a client in the alcoholic beverage industry in South East Asia, and would be interested in getting some expertise from your experts.
 
The expert profiles we are interested in are people with extensive knowledge in the supply Chain of beer. Therefore we would like to speak to senior experts responding to following:
 
1.    Positions (current or past)
a.    Country managers
b.    Production managers
c.    CFO

2.    Companies:
a.    SAB Miller
b.    Heineken
c.    AB Inbev
d.    Carlsberg Group

3.    Geographies:
a.    South East Asia
b.    North America
c.    Europe

Our objective is to speak to 3-6 experts, balanced between the geographies.

1.    Case code is AJNT
2.    Beer manufacturer
3.    If possible before next Thursday (11th of June)
As always, please do not reach out to experts before we have cleared them from our end. For purposes of conflict checking, it would greatly expedite our process if you could include in your email an excel file that includes ONLY a column of the companies that need to be checked.  Look forward to hearing from you and working with you on this project. 
 
Do not hesitate to call me should you need more information,  
 
Best,
 
Alexander
 
Alexander Alpers

Thanks and we look forward to speaking with you soon.

description:
Hi guys
 
We’re kicking off a new project (case code yet to be provided) in Australia and NZ. This is a bit different from the usual work that we do, because on this project we are looking at gyms and fitness providers instead of education. We need to speak to senior personnel who work in any of the big chain gyms in Australia NZ (fitness first, fernwood women’s gyms, curves, goodlife health, step into life, genesis fitness club, jetts fitness, plus fitness, anytime fitness, snap fitness are some names that come to mind, but feel free to do your own research and add big chains to this list. We are also interested in speaking to anyone at independent gyms which are of reasonable (~100 members) scale- perhaps a contact at the big chain gyms might know someone who is doing something like this)
 
We want to get an understanding of the following
 
·         The market landscape for gyms/fitness centres in Australia/NZ- number of people participating, typical price points, major players, other ways of segmenting this market, typical buying unit (eg 1 month, 3 month memberships), frequency of payments, main methods of payment (direct debit vs cards)

·         The type of IT systems used by gyms- who makes the buying decision, how long are contracts valid for, what software is used for functions like marketing, member sign up, payments processing, debt collection)

·         Whether most of the aforementioned functions are usually done in-house or outsourced, if outsourced, to who? What are the key business drivers of such a decision?

·         Mapping out the value chain of gyms

 
we are hoping to start interviews 2nd half of this week and do between 4-5 experts. End client is a potential investor in the Australia/NZ health and fitness space.

================

Hi guys
 
As a second request, we need to speak to people at firms which design gym management software (this software typically deals with a range of functions such as new member sign ups, class management, payment processing, debt collection, CRM). Some shortlisted companies below, but others are also welcome if they’re in a similar line of business with an AUS/NZ focus.
 
·         GymMaster (Treshna)

·         Intellifitness (Intelligenz Solutions)

·         Iconnect360

·         Virtuagym

 
We want to find out more about the market dynamics of this industry- who are the key players, how saturated is the market, what are typical arrangements like between gyms and software providers (licensing, duration of contract, royalties), key decision criteria of buyers. Also relevant is to find out a bit more what the outlook for growth is.
 
Because of the type of questions we are asking, we suggest you try and speak with someone in sales.
 
Please do not approach anyone who works at the following firms/on the following products
 
·         Clubware

·         DebitSuccess

·         Paysmart

·         Harlands Group

·         DFC

·         Transaction services group

 
End client is the same as previous request

description:
Hi 

We are working on a high priority client development opportunity in India (with a real estate developer). In this context, need your help in identifying an expert on design of mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems for high-rise buildings. 

Such experts could be working in firms such as Jacobs Engineering, Parsons Brinckerhoff, Exp, HDR Inc. Stantec Inc. etc. and should be either leading design functions or should be a senior designer. We are agnostic to the geography the expert has experience in (though would prefer an expert that can speak English well).

CC: IN1310 (a client development effort). 

This is a time critical request and would be great if you can revert with a few profiles before EOD.

Thanks a ton in advance!!

Regards,
Anish

=========

1) This is for a residential high-rise
2) ED is Suveer Sinha and EM would be me
3) This is a proposal for an engagement, hence even preliminary profiles should work for now  -

For this month, we plan to have 1-2 discussions to A) screen the expert, and B) start preliminary discussions on design optimization
From July (when the engagement should kick-off), we would need to interact with experts over a 3 month period with a min. of 8-10 discussions

4) Context of expert conversations: Would need expert inputs to review the designs (prepared by Indian firms) and come out with ideas for cost savings through design optimization of MEP systems

=========

Thanks Jin. This is helpful but we are currently not very keen to onboard an Indian expert.

In the meanwhile, I have spoken to a few people who know the design space well, and they suggested that we try and identify MEP design experts from the following companies - WS Atkins, Arup, WSP Global, Ian Banham & Associates, Meinhardt, Cosentini Associates, and Buro Happold.

They also suggested that we look for subject specific experts, i.e., experts in HVAC / Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing / Fire fighting. This is because very few people have deep technical expertise across the board in this area. Therefore, could you please push our search to experts from these firms.

Regards,
Anish

Experts from South East Asia and Middle East would be best suited (given that they are English speaking and in the same approx. time zone).

description:
Hello Jennifer,
 
Our Bain Private Equity team is kicking off a new project today that we could use your help on:
 
Context: Our client is a financial investor thinking about purchasing Sperry Drilling, which is a Halliburton business being put up for sale in connection with their announced acquisition of Baker Hughes. Sperry Drilling’s primary operations are in directional drilling, measurement while drilling (MWD) / logging while drilling  (LWD) and drilling engineering solutions. We are primary interested in understanding:
 
1)     How viable Sperry Drilling is as a standalone entity separate from Halliburton. To this end, we need to understand how drilling services are typically procured, how often drilling services are bought as part of a bundle of other services, how compelling the Sperry brand is, and how customers decide between Sperry and it’s 3-4 competitors.

 

2)     How well-positioned Sperry Drilling is with regards to technology. To this end, we need to understand how technical innovation occurs in this market, how important technology is as a competitive differentiator, and how differentiated Sperry’s technology is relative to competitors.

 

Our mandate is to investigate Sperry Drilling and the drilling market in APAC only.
 
Customers (n=10-20): We'd like to get good coverage of drilling customers, including international oil companies, national oil companies, and independent oil companies across APAC, with broad experience across offshore drilling, and conventional land drilling. Sperry’s customer base includes the following companies, which should be a good starting point:
 
·         International Oil Companies (IOCs)

o    Shell

o    BP

o    Total

o    ConocoPhillips

o    Chevron

·         National Oil Companies (NOCs)

o    PTT

o    Petronas

o    Pertamina

o     

·         Independent Oil Companies

o    Anadarko

o    Apache

o    Chesapeake Energy

o    Devon Energy

 
Some ideal job titles might be VP of drilling operations, VP of Procurement, etc.
 
Competitors (n=5-10): We’d also like to speak to current or former employees of some of Sperry’s competitors with a focus on APAC. These include:
 
·         Weatherford International

·         Schlumberger

·         Baker Hughes

 
Experts (n=5-10): It would also be valuable to speak to any industry experts or consultants in the drilling industry with a particular focus in APAC.
 
Timeline: Phase 1 of this project will run from today until 7/1. As such, time is of the essence; we’d like to schedule 1-2 calls for tomorrow and ~30 calls altogether. The 1-2 calls for tomorrow would ideally include an industry expert since we’re still getting up to speed on the drilling world.
 
Screening questions:
 
·         Customers

o    Have you made purchasing decisions regarding drilling services in the past 12 months?
o    How familiar are you with Sperry Drilling in APAC?
o    Can you speak to the strengths and weaknesses of the competitors within the drilling market, especially with regards to technology?
o    Can you speak to how drilling contracts are typically structured (esp. in APAC)?
 
·         Competitors

o    Can you speak to the major purchasing criteria involved in selecting a drilling provider?
o    Can you speak to how drilling contracts are typically structured (esp. in APAC)?
o    Can you speak to the strengths and weaknesses of the competitors within the drilling market, especially with regards to technology?
 
·         Experts

o    Can you speak to the major purchasing criteria involved in selecting a drilling provider?
o    How familiar are you with Sperry Drilling?
o    Can you speak to the strengths and weaknesses of the competitors within the drilling market, especially with regards to technology?
o    How is the market of direction drilling evolving in APAC?
 
Case code: Not yet created, but I will get back to you with this later in the day
 
Thanks for your help!
 
Ben
 
Benjamin Soccal

I have any update on this request:
1.       First priority: Could you get back to me with another filtering. We are now looking after more technical profile in the drilling industry in APAC i.e. people who have had the chance to work with Sperry, Schlumberger and Baker Hughes as a customer. You can test their knowledge in the topic with the following questions:

a.       Do you understand the technical specificities required from drilling service providers for the different types of fields (e.g. onshore vs. deepwater)?

b.      Do you understand the technical differences in products and services delivered between the 3 players and how they are positioned to deliver on the different types of fields?

c.       Do you understand the trend of bundling/ unbundling services in the contract between drilling service providers and customers (IOCs, NOCs and independents)?

2.       Second priority: Could you get back to me with 1-2 industry experts on the similar topic as my previous email with a focus on Russia instead of APAC? Please be very selective as we are planning to have 1-2 interviews max.

 
Please get back to me ASAP on the first priority (i.e. before 1pm)
 
Ben

1.       First priority: Could you get back to me with another filtering. We are now looking after more technical profile in the drilling industry in APAC i.e. people who have had the chance to work with Sperry, Schlumberger and Baker Hughes as a customer. You can test their knowledge in the topic with the following questions:

a.       Do you understand the technical specificities required from drilling service providers for the different types of fields (e.g. onshore vs. deepwater)?

b.      Do you understand the technical differences in products and services delivered between the 3 players and how they are positioned to deliver on the different types of fields?

c.       Do you understand the trend of bundling/ unbundling services in the contract between drilling service providers and customers (IOCs, NOCs and independents)?

2.       Second priority: Could you get back to me with 1-2 industry experts on the similar topic as my previous email with a focus on Russia instead of APAC? Please be very selective as we are planning to have 1-2 interviews max.

---------------

We are still interested in discussing with experts.
 
We are now rather focusing on the competitive positioning and specific differences between the drilling services providers in terms of pricing, technology and service.
 
No need to focus on customers of NOCs, we would rather be interested in proper industry experts.
 
Could you get back to us with profile to interview today? Please test them on the topic.

description:
Dear Jin,
We are working with a player in the Personal & Beauty Care industry and we are looking at how to optimize their Product Claims support process in India.
In that context, we would like to interview experts with the following characteristics:
 
- Geography of expertise: India
 
- Background:
 
•        Has been working for a FMCG in relation to claims development / support process (e.g. R&D, Innovation, Marketing….) in India – ideally based out of India but OK if significant experience / knowledge about processes & regulations in India

•        Other experts (e.g. from governmental / regulatory agencies which are dealing with claims support / challenges) that you consider relevant

- We would like the expert to discuss the following best practices in terms of claims support processes
 
•        Operating models - organization structure, roles and responsibilities by function, communication / coordination / interaction between R&D and Marketing…

•        Processes - claims support processes + related processes (e.g. innovation process, product development, claims development...)

•        Systems and tools - knowledge / data management, monitoring and reporting systems, level of automation….

 
Would appreciate if you could share the list of available experts that we could potentially tap into and interview. We are working under tight deadlines so it would be great if you could get back to us asap
 
Best
 
Olivier
 
Olivier Gergele

description:
Hi Jennifer,
 
 
My name is Qin Zhu, and I’m a consultant with Bain Singapore.  I’m currently working on a project to sketch out the pro forma P&L (cost and revenue drivers) of developing a data analytics unit for a retail client, so I’m looking to speak with experts who’ve had experience rolling out big data teams/developing data analytic capabilities for a retail chain (preferably a supermarket). 
 
The specific questions that we would like to answer are listed below: 
What are some typical benchmarks to determine the appropriate size/spend on a data analytics team, given a firm’s revenue?
o    How should we think about this e.g. ratio of DA cost to firm’s revenue?

o    Does this differ for inhouse/captive vs pure play DA companies? (companies that specialize in DA)

o    What percentage of that spend is towards employee pay vs software infrastructure vs overhead and etc.?

-      What are types of upside and benchmarks for the upside/value creation from data analytics investments, especially in a retail/supermarket context. For example

o    Revenue from selling of data e.g. analytics report to a supermarket’s suppliers – what is typical pricing, upside from this

o    Performance improvement upside (from better inventory/stocking, cross-selling, etc.) – what are benchmarks for these?

o    Revenue from selling consulting services

-      What is the typical revenue model for an internal DA shared service center/COE that offers services to other Bus within the firm e.g.

o    At cost, cost plus, market rate, etc.

 
Experts that we’d be most interested in speaking with are:  
-      Ex data analytics or chief information officers.  Preferably someone who has retail (supermarket) experience, who’s been in charge or have helped build out data analytic units and understand both the infrastructure and personnel needs.   

-      Suppliers from data/IT firms that have helped retailers to roll out data analytical units.

Industry of focus: Road construction equipment

Number of Interviews: 5-6 

Profile of experts would include one or more of the following: 
1) Ex-executives (ideally responsible for international expansion) at companies such as - Wirtgen, Sakai, Sany, XCMG, Zoomlion 
2) Ex-executives from Caterpillar (focusing on road construction equipment) 
3) Industry experts working with consultancy firms that specialize in Road Construction Equipment (such as Off-highway Research) 

Key areas for discussion 
1) Industry trends (drivers and challenges) 
2) Key success factors for internationalization into new markets 
3) Upcoming business models and business segments 
4) Others 

If you need any clarification, don't hesitate to get in touch over email or my mobile (91446844). I look forward to hearing from you on this soon! 

Regards

For the international outbound expansion knowledge - do you have any countries / areas of focus? 

F&S: Nope, we do not have any particular countries of focus. 

Can I have an idea on the nature of end client? (Competitor, investment, DD report, general research, etc to manage conflicts of interest)

Also, please provide a general timing/schedule on your end. 

F&S: This is a very time-sensitive engagement for us and we would like to finish these interviews over the next 2 weeks surely (by 24th July 2015)

description:
This is from PwC Strategy in Shanghai, and referred by PwC Strategy in Singapore (Dimitri). 

We are currently working on a bunkering project, and we are trying to reach out to industry experts for interviews to get some insight. Could you please help arrange some expert interviews in Singapore based on the following requirements? 

Experts responsible for bunkering or trading of oil and gas product in the following companies are preferred: 
1. Major oil company: BP, Shell, ExxonMobile, Sinopec Fuel Oil (Singapore) Company 
2. Independent physical supplier: Brightoil, AEGEAN MARINE PETROLEUM, World Fuel Service, OW Bunker 
3. Oil subsidiary for shipping company: COSCO (Sinfeng Marine Services Pte. Ltd., China Marine Bunker Supply Company, Costank (S) Pte Ltd), China Shipping (Singapore) Petroleum PTE LTD, China Changjiang Bunker (Sinopec) Co., Ltd. 

Could you please provide interview candidates along with quotation as soon as possible. 

High-level interview guides for your and experts' reference: 
1. Bunkering (both trade and physical supply)
High level brief on global bunker industry (including main trading centre, main fuelling ports, major players, future trends, etc.)
Market size, historical growth rate, industry driver, estimated growth of bunkering in different regions (focusing on Singapore, ship owners from China, East Asia and Southeast Asia)
The sales volume of bunkering in main fuelling ports (especially Singapore), and end customer segmentation
Value chain of global bunkering and fuel oil supply market, including value chain components, major participants, value chain covering of participants, bargaining power, profit margin, key success factor, future development trend, etc.
Competition landscape of bunker market in Singapore (bunker trade and physical supply), including major competitors, market share, future trends on competition landscape

2.        Other refined oil and gas product industry (including crude oil, gasoline, kerosene, jet fuel, distillate fuel oil, residual fuel oil, lubricating oil, LPG, LNG )
High level brief of global refined oil and gas trade industry (market size, future growth rate, key driver, etc.)
Value chain of refined oil and gas trade industry, including value chain components, major participants, value chain covering of participants, bargaining power, profit margin, key success factor, future development trend, etc.
Attractiveness comparison on different oil & gas products, the key success factor and capability in this industry

We expect that the experts should have solid knowledge and deep understanding on bunkering or refined oil and gas product trade. Meanwhile, it is important that the expert is willing to share his/her own working experience and company information.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon. 

Best Regards,

There is no specific deadline for our project, but we are seeking expert interviews as soon as possible, like several calls within this week. 
Our client is a shipping company. 
We are considering 3-4 calls based on the suitability of the experts you recommended.

We’re also looking for experts in Singapore who might have an idea of the following:
1)      what premium international schools are doing to give back to the local community and 2) the EDB(Economic Development Board) selection process.

 
They could be:
1.       Former employees of the EDB Singapore (Economic  Development Board)

2.       Employees with a premium international school in Singapore

 
Screener questions:
1.       What are the following premium international schools doing to give back to the Singapore community?

a.       UWC

b.      Dulwich College

c.       AIS

d.      GEMS

e.      Tanglin Trust

f.        Canadian International School (CIS)

g.       Singapore American

h.      Stamford

i.         Avondale

j.        ISS

k.       Overseas Family

l.         Nexus

2.       What other innovative approaches to giving back / Singapore First have schools taken?

3.       How does the EDB evaluate how effective an initiative is in giving back to the Singaporean community?

4.       What are the criteria that are most important for EDB during an RFI process?

5.       What is the process by which a school / winner is selected during an RFI process?

6.       What are the factors that make the difference between a winning and non-winning application?

 
 
Would it be possible to get in touch with such experts?
 
Thanks and regards
Mallika

Hi Mihir,
 
Hope you’re well. As part of a diligence project, we are looking to speak with experts on revenues and costs for a premium international school in Singapore.
These are typically schools which charge more than SGD30k per student per year as tuition fees and enrol only expats i.e. international schools
To be specific, we shall be interested in knowing in detail about the:
 

-          Costs consisting of the breakdown as follows

o   Staff costs

§  Lab assistant, computer staff, librarian, PE instructor, other admin staff costs

§  School marketing head salary, finance head salary, HR head salary, Admin head salary

o   Utility costs

§  Electricity costs (as a % of Revenue or per student cost)

§  Internet costs (as a % of Revenue or per student cost)

§  Other utilities (as a % of Revenue or per student cost)

o   Maintenance costs (as a % of Revenue or % of capex)

o   Marketing costs (as a product of cost per applicant * no. of applicants )

o   Royalty fees estimate

o   Corporate Overhead

 
-           Revenue consisting of the breakdown as follows

o   Revenue via tuition fees

o   Revenue via registration fees

o   Revenue via professional development fees

o   Endowments

o   Loss of Revenue via scholarships

 
-          I understand that for most of these costs and Revenues will only be able to get estimates/approximations.

 

Expert Profile
  We would like to speak to either
·         A senior personnel (such as CFO) who has worked in the finance department of a premium international school in Singapore

·         A senior personnel who has worked in the financial planning of a premium school in Singapore

 
We are working on very tight timelines. Would really appreciate a quick turnaround.
Thanks and I look forward to hearing from you! Please feel free to let me know if you have any questions.
 
Thanks,
Rishikesh

1. Are you looking for an expert who is knowledgeable about several markets in Asia, or would you be open to talk to experts who can only cover 1 country? [single country is fine]
3. By "markets with multiple franchisees operating in them" - do you mean countries where KFC has given franchise rights to several operators (franchisees) vs. sole operator? [correct]
3. Do you have brief topics (eg. how to structure franchisor/franchisee relationship between single vs multiple operators)?
-am trying to better understand the motivation for having multiple franchisees other than natural geographic barriers eg peninsular and east msia; what are the areas for collaboration (eg economies of scale, national marketing, product development) and areas of competition (adjacent territories, mall relationships, new development areas etc)
4. What's your timeline? [asap; end of week latest - let me know if this is an issue.so we can explore other channels]

You can mention that we are an investment fund based in sg.

http://www.bangkokpost.com/business/news/575015/yum-to-pluck-new-franchisee-for-kfc-outlet-expansion

description:
Hi Maria,
Do you have expert in the above sector for Philippines?
 
For now, we want someone who can comment in detail on:
-       Market outlook – size, growth, consumer attitude

-       Competitive landscape – we understand specialty stores are relatively nascent, so leave you to be creative here on expert profile e.g. expert may potentially worked at a brand owner previously (perfume brand employee); knowledgeable due to prior study of the market for distributors/ detailers, etc

-       Key trends and growth drivers

=================================

Thanks, Maria.
Trouble you to refine this further:

-       Fragrance sub-segment remains priority.  Appears that the experts are still more beauty care products driven.  If you are facing constraints here, please let us know.  Also, appreciate your feedback on nuances (if any), e.g. Fragrance market is not large enough to justify a single business head, etc

-       Experts with a view of the growth outside of Luzon.  Particularly, growth prospects in areas such as Visayas and Mindanao – be it by way of distribution via modern trade or general trade, or direct retailing


Hope this helps.  Please do not hesitate to call to discuss.  Best regards.
Yeow Hua

========================
when you screen KPs, ask them if they cover those areas, luzon, mindanao and visayas. and also, how distributors usually group those areas and from where they manage them. that might help our research (

description:
Hi Maria,
 
I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to speak to experts in the Indonesian cement industry.
 
Questions that we would like to talk about out are:
 
-          Drivers of cement demand / supply

o   Expected future growth rates by end-use

o   Expected future growth rates by region (Java, Sumatra, etc.)

-          Issues with Indonesian cement industry

o   Issues with each player e.g., Holcim, Indocement, etc.

-          Distribution channel: e.g., dealers vs. direct

o   Distribution strategy of each player

-          Margins within the industry e.g., how much does the manufacturer / distributor make for bag / bulk cement, etc.

-          Key purchase criteria for each enduser type e.g., large contractors, infrastructure projects, small home builders, RMC / Precast, etc.

 
We want to schedule a call with the expert as early as next Monday. Let me know if you have any questions
 
Thanks,
Pat
 
Pattanit Chareonkul • L.E.K. CONSULTING PTE LTD

metadata.job_title: Vice President, Strategy and Special Projects

description:
Dear Jennifer,
 
Hope you’re well. My colleagues referred me to you and I wanted to get the first cut of profiles by 4:30pm this afternoon so I can present a shortlist at 5pm.
 
We’re doing market research into the Singapore  third party logistics and warehousing market. You may also see it refer to as “3PL” (3rd party logistics) or “contract logistics”. Examples of these companies include:
-      Toll (Singapore division)

-      DB Shenker (Singapore division)

-      YCH Logistics

-      CWT

-      Keppel Telecommunications & Transportation

-      Poh Tiong Choon

-      Vibrant Logistics (formerly Freight Links)

-      Cougar Logistics

-      NYK Logistics

 
We want to get an understanding of the market, such as supply/demand trends, competitive landscape, business models, customer relationships and corporate strategies. As such, I think it would be helpful to speak to current/former employees of companies such as those above (and any other relevant ones) for a mix of these roles:
-      General management

-      Strategy

-      Sales/marketing

-      Any other roles that will be able to address some of the points above

 
As I mentioned, can we get a first cut of profiles by 4:30pm this afternoon? We have an internal meeting at 5pm and I would like to go through the list and present my suggestions to the team.
 
I can send you screening questions afterwards and we will look to start scheduling these calls from next Monday.
 
As a heads up, we will also want to understand customer preferences and behavior a bit better, so will follow up with another request this afternoon for the customer list.
 
Please keep my colleagues copied on all correspondence as I am out of the office tomorrow afternoon. Heath will probably take the lead on scheduling tomorrow afternoon once we have narrowed down our list.
 
Thank you!
Ivan
 
PS: case code is AQYC

·         Hemophilia: experts who can comment on diagnosis and treatment of hemophilia in Vietnam
o    Hematologists/Doctors/pharma staff working for major hospitals
o    Staff of National Institute of Hematology and Blood Transfusion in Vietnam
o    Staff of Vietnam Hemophilia Association/ other associations of hemophilia
o    Employees of pharma distributors/ former employees of pharma manufacturers

·         Albumin: Experts who can comment on treatment using Albumin (usually Treatments are for Intensive Care Unit or liver patients)
o    Intensive Care Unit or Liver doctors/pharma staff
o    Employees of pharma distributors/ former employees of pharma manufacturers of Albumin.
 
In term of timeline, we are hoping to talk to them end of this week and early next week. It will be great if you could share with us profiles tomorrow. I will let you know once I get the case code for this project.
